Package bankapplication

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • bankapplication.Account

  • public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Account contains methods to perform the basic operations of an account such as depositing and withdrawal of money.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Account​(int accNo, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String addr, double bal)
      This constructor initializes the account with the details of the holder and with a minimum balance of Rs.500.0/-.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void checkBalance​()
      This method displays the current balance on the standard output.
      void deposit​(double amt)
      This method deposits amount in the account.
      java.lang.String getAccHolderAddr​()
      This method returns the address of the account holder.
      java.lang.String getAccHolderName​()
      This method returns the account holders name.
      int getAccountNumber​()
      This method returns the account number.
      double getAmount​()
      This method reads the amount to be deposited or withdrawn, from the standard input.
      double getBalance​()
      This methods gets the current balance in the account.
      void setBalance​(double balance)
      This method sets the account balance to the value of the parameter
      void withdraw​(double amt)
      This method withdraws amount from the account.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Account

        public Account​(int accNo,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String addr,
               double bal)
        This constructor initializes the account with the details of the holder and with a minimum balance of Rs.500.0/-.
        Parameters:
        accNo - This is the account number of the account
        name - Name of the account holder.
        addr - Address of the account holder.
        bal - Balance in the account.

    • Method Detail

      • getBalance

        public double getBalance​()
        This methods gets the current balance in the account.
        Returns:
        current balance.

      • setBalance

        public void setBalance​(double balance)
        This method sets the account balance to the value of the parameter
        Parameters:
        balance - The balance value to be set.

      • getAccountNumber

        public int getAccountNumber​()
        This method returns the account number.
        Returns:
        Account number

      • getAccHolderName

        public java.lang.String getAccHolderName​()
        This method returns the account holders name.
        Returns:
        The account holders name.

      • getAccHolderAddr

        public java.lang.String getAccHolderAddr​()
        This method returns the address of the account holder.
        Returns:
        Account holders address.

      • getAmount

        public double getAmount​()
        This method reads the amount to be deposited or withdrawn, from the standard input.
        Returns:
        amount to be deposited/withdrawn.

      • deposit

        public void deposit​(double amt)
        This method deposits amount in the account. The amount to be deposited is taken as user input. The balance after depositing is displayed on the standard output.

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw​(double amt)
        This method withdraws amount from the account. the amount to be withdrawn is taken as user input. Only if a balance greater than Rs.500.0/- can be retained, can the withdrawal succeed. The balance after depositing is displayed on the standard output.

      • checkBalance

        public void checkBalance​()
        This method displays the current balance on the standard output.
